title: "AI Makes Hiding Your Kids’ Identity on the Internet More Important Than Ever. But It’s Also Harder to Do."
excerpt: "Reynolds recommends that parents search online for their children’s faces using a service like PimEyes or FaceCheck.ID. If they don’t like what comes up, they should try to get the websites the photo was posted on to take it down, she said. (Some will, but others — like news outlets — might not.)"
